intro: Adenolobus garipensis, commonly known as the Turkish bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Adenolobus garipensis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
